content: Google and Microsoft have co-authored the WebMCP specification, which aims to transform every website into an API for AI agents.
WebMCP (Web Model Context Protocol) is a browser API standard, `navigator.modelContext`, that allows websites to register structured tools directly in client-side JavaScript for AI agents.
With WebMCP, AI agents can read a menu of available actions from a website, call them, and receive structured data back, eliminating the need for screen scraping or backend MCP servers.
Early benchmarks for WebMCP show approximately a 67% reduction in computational overhead compared to visual agent-browser interactions and around 98% task accuracy.
